name: Defender of the Underdark (Druid 7 / Shifter 10 / DD 23)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Edited after Yunim's comment

This is a build concept, not yet completed, that attempts to obtain high AB through a high strength score in a shifter build. 

It's not a new idea and I understand Mick Dagger created a dev crit Kobold Commando shifter with a AB of 42 wielding a +3 sword. 

However I'm not sure if high Str shifter + DD has been made before

I have chosen to focus on shifted forms that transfer strength, namely the gargoyle form (not the epic gargoyle however), kobold commando and mindflayer forms.

The Risen Lord form is included for tankability

This build draft has four primary forms to use in combat:

1. Dwarven Defender - this is the normal form, has spellcasting, wields a shortsword and shield, has DR 15/-, over 500hp, base AB 43.

2. Kobold Commando - this form has a base AB 43 (46 with the +3 sword), 2d6 sneak attack, HiPS (albeit very poor stealth but it is self-buffable with camouflage and one with the land), DR 15/-
3. Gargoyle Form - this form has base AB 40 with improved critical unarmed, 15/+1 damage reduction stacking with the DR 15/-. Seems pretty strong early levels.
4. Mindflayer Form -  it has a base AB of 40 with improved critical unarmed, has mind immunity, DR 15/- and this is the funniest form, it attacks opponents by head butting them with its tenticular face

5. Risen Lord Form for tankability but not offensive power

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Dru7/Shif11/DD22 gives you epic Gargoyle form at the cost of 4 HP. If you're not going for the bare minimum or epic Kobold Commando then I would switch to that level layout.
Another slight change, if you're going for Shif10 I think you should pick up Undead Shape even if it means lowering STR. Risen Lord DD is a fairly standard DR tank due to 50% DI and critical immunity, and it is a very nice backup shape to have.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Yunim for the tip on the risen lord. I'll see if I can find a way to incorporate it
I haven't gone Shifter 11+ because I wanted to keep the standard gargoyle form which transfers the characters Str stat to the shifted form. Epic Gargoyle form had about 6 less AB when I loaded up the character in PGCC

Edit: added undead shape, added a dev crit version. What do you think now?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
If I was to make them myself I would drop the starting STR to 16 for more CON and INT, but for minmaxed builds they both look good.

Epic Gargoyle drops your AB by 6 compared to the pre-epic form, but you gain 25/+7 DR which lets you penetrate X/+7 DR with your unarmed attacks. A pre-epic Gargoyle can't scratch an Adamantine Golem (50/+7 DR), but an epic Gargoyle can (although both AB and damage are low). It's a tricky choice though since the AB is already fairly low, sticking with pre-epic Gargoyle might be a better choice depending on your opponents.
